resources.string:
Across Quindío will let you know one of the most visit department of Colombia.
"Go through Quindío is easy, pleasant and fun ..."
Visit Panaca and spend some time in family.
Visit El Parque Nacional del café and ride The Krater.
Welcome!\nHere, you find useful information about Armenia, Quindío (Colombia).\n
¿Are you looking for some place to spend the night?
\nThe hotel with the best location in the downtown of Armenia. 19 modern room with private bathroom, WiFi and cable Tv.\n

Ubicado en el Municipio de Montenegro, permite conocer las tradiciones y cultura cafetera; dentro de sus atractivos se destacan: el monumento al café, el recorrido ecológico, montaña rusa, caballos, el jardín de fábulas, helipuerto, pueblo paisa y paseo en tren, entre otros.

ESCRÍBENOS A:servicioalcliente@parquedelcafe.co
LLÁMANOS AL: PBX (6) – 7417417
Domingo a Domingo de 8am – 6pm
WEB: http://www.parquedelcafe.co/
Dirección: Km 6 vía Montenegro Pueblo Tapao Quindío – Colombia

Quindio department is located in the west-central region of the country and is part of El Eje Cafetero; it is known for its beautiful scenery of green mountains decorated by coffee plantations and lush plants. Quindio is proudly cradle of Colombian national tree: La Palma de Cera\n
The population, mostly mestizo, stemmed from indigenous groups mix with Spaniards. Colonization of Antioquia, in the early nineteenth century, just as marked characteristics in the population.

Quindío Department has 543.532 people, which the 87%% lives in urban headers and the 13%% in rural areas. The residents of Quindió are called Quindiano and the people who lives in Armenia, the capital, are called Cuyabros.
